main event: A ground-based radar detected a fast-moving object the size of a basketball flying in a circular pattern over Southwick, Massachusetts on September 29, 1959.
interesting points: The object was detected by radar but not seen visually.
The object was estimated to be about 20 feet in diameter and glowed a dark reddish color.
The object shot off white sparks in a circular pattern as it flew.
The object was initially spotted at an elevation of 6,000 feet and then suddenly appeared at an elevation of over 500 feet.
The object was observed for about 12 minutes before disappearing beyond a tree-covered hill.
sighted object: A fast-moving, glowing object detected on radar
photographs: Yes, the report includes color slides and transparencies
